article.Heading: Union Budget 2017-18: LIC to offer 8% return in pension scheme for senior citizens
article.Summary: This will be annual guaranteed return for all above 60 years of age
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) will now offer a guaranteed return of 8 percent per annum under a new pension scheme for senior citizens. Finance minister Arun Jaitley in his budget speech said that this scheme will be implemented by the largest public sector insurer in the country.

Currently, as per the regulatory norms, insurance companies are required to offer a non-zero guaranteed return which has to be disclosed upfront at the time of product filing. Hence, returns could vary from one insurer to the other based on their investment strategies.

Senior citizens, who do not have a steady flow of income will be benefitted with the new scheme that will help them earn returns on par with other market instruments. This could also be a direct competition to schemes like National Pension Scheme (NPS).

Being the large insurer with a large investable corpus, LIC, will be able to offer a higher rate of return. It is not yet clear whether other insurers will also be included in this scheme at a later date.
